<?php
/**
 * WordPress Configuration for Docker Environment
 *
 * This file contains the WordPress configuration for the local Docker environment.
 * Rename this file to wp-config.php when using Docker.
 */

// ** Database settings ** //
define( 'DB_NAME', 'tucrkdmuqj' );
define( 'DB_USER', 'tucrkdmuqj' );
define( 'DB_PASSWORD', 'U4b8cG5gzu' );
define( 'DB_HOST', 'mariadb' ); // Docker service name
define( 'DB_CHARSET', 'utf8mb4' );
define( 'DB_COLLATE', '' );

// ** Authentication unique keys and salts ** //
// Generate these from: https://api.wordpress.org/secret-key/1.1/salt/
define( 'AUTH_KEY',         'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'SECURE_AUTH_KEY',  'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'LOGGED_IN_KEY',    'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'NONCE_KEY',        'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'AUTH_SALT',        'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'SECURE_AUTH_SALT', 'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'LOGGED_IN_SALT',   'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'NONCE_SALT',       'put your unique phrase here' );

// ** WordPress Database Table prefix ** //
$table_prefix = 'wp_';

// ** For developers: WordPress debugging mode ** //
define( 'WP_DEBUG', true );
define( 'WP_DEBUG_LOG', true );
define( 'WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY', false );
define( 'SCRIPT_DEBUG', true );

// ** Site URL Configuration ** //
define( 'WP_HOME', 'http://www.gioielleriabonanno.it.local' );
define( 'WP_SITEURL', 'http://www.gioielleriabonanno.it.local' );

// ** Redis Object Cache Configuration ** //
define( 'WP_REDIS_HOST', 'redis' );
define( 'WP_REDIS_PORT', 6379 );
define( 'WP_REDIS_DATABASE', 0 );
define( 'WP_REDIS_TIMEOUT', 1 );
define( 'WP_REDIS_READ_TIMEOUT', 1 );

// ** Memory Limits ** //
define( 'WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '256M' );
define( 'WP_MAX_MEMORY_LIMIT', '512M' );

// ** File System Method ** //
define( 'FS_METHOD', 'direct' );

// ** Disable automatic updates in local environment ** //
define( 'AUTOMATIC_UPDATER_DISABLED', true );
define( 'WP_AUTO_UPDATE_CORE', false );

// ** Mail Configuration (using Mailhog) ** //
define( 'SMTP_HOST', 'mailhog' );
define( 'SMTP_PORT', 1025 );

/* That's all, stop editing! Happy publishing. */

/** Absolute path to the WordPress directory. */
if ( ! defined( 'ABSPATH' ) ) {
    define( 'ABSPATH', __DIR__ . '/' );
}

/** Sets up WordPress vars and included files. */
require_once ABSPATH . 'wp-settings.php';

<?php
/**
 * The base configuration for WordPress
 *
 * The wp-config.php creation script uses this file during the installation.
 * You don't have to use the website, you can copy this file to "wp-config.php"
 * and fill in the values.
 *
 * This file contains the following configurations:
 *
 * * Database settings
 * * Secret keys
 * * Database table prefix
 * * ABSPATH
 *
 * @link https://developer.wordpress.org/advanced-administration/wordpress/wp-config/
 *
 * @package WordPress
 */

// ** Database settings - You can get this info from your web host ** //
/** The name of the database for WordPress */
define( 'DB_NAME', 'database_name_here' );

/** Database username */
define( 'DB_USER', 'username_here' );

/** Database password */
define( 'DB_PASSWORD', 'password_here' );

/** Database hostname */
define( 'DB_HOST', 'localhost' );

/** Database charset to use in creating database tables. */
define( 'DB_CHARSET', 'utf8' );

/** The database collate type. Don't change this if in doubt. */
define( 'DB_COLLATE', '' );

/**#@+
 * Authentication unique keys and salts.
 *
 * Change these to different unique phrases! You can generate these using
 * the {@link https://api.wordpress.org/secret-key/1.1/salt/ WordPress.org secret-key service}.
 *
 * You can change these at any point in time to invalidate all existing cookies.
 * This will force all users to have to log in again.
 *
 * @since 2.6.0
 */
define( 'AUTH_KEY',         'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'SECURE_AUTH_KEY',  'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'LOGGED_IN_KEY',    'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'NONCE_KEY',        'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'AUTH_SALT',        'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'SECURE_AUTH_SALT', 'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'LOGGED_IN_SALT',   'put your unique phrase here' );
define( 'NONCE_SALT',       'put your unique phrase here' );

/**#@-*/

/**
 * WordPress database table prefix.
 *
 * You can have multiple installations in one database if you give each
 * a unique prefix. Only numbers, letters, and underscores please!
 */
$table_prefix = 'wp_';

/**
 * For developers: WordPress debugging mode.
 *
 * Change this to true to enable the display of notices during development.
 * It is strongly recommended that plugin and theme developers use WP_DEBUG
 * in their development environments.
 *
 * For information on other constants that can be used for debugging,
 * visit the documentation.
 *
 * @link https://developer.wordpress.org/advanced-administration/debug/debug-wordpress/
 */
define( 'WP_DEBUG', false );

/* Add any custom values between this line and the "stop editing" line. */



/* That's all, stop editing! Happy publishing. */

/** Absolute path to the WordPress directory. */
if ( ! defined( 'ABSPATH' ) ) {
	define( 'ABSPATH', __DIR__ . '/' );
}

/** Sets up WordPress vars and included files. */
require_once ABSPATH . 'wp-settings.php';

define( 'WP_CACHE', true ); // Added by WP Rocket
/**

 *
 * This file has the following configurations: MySQL settings, Table Prefix,
 * Secret Keys, WordPress Language, and ABSPATH. You can find more information

 * wp-config.php} Codex page. You can get the MySQL settings from your web host.
 *
 * This file is used by the wp-config.php creation script during the
 * installation. You don't have to use the web site, you can just copy this file
 * to "wp-config.php" and fill in the values.
 *
 * @package WordPress
 */
// ** MySQL settings - You can get this info from your web host ** //
/** ElasticPress */
define( 'EP_HOST', 'http://elasticsearch:9200' );
/** The name of the database for WordPress */
define('DB_NAME', 'tucrkdmuqj');
/** MySQL database username */
define('DB_USER', 'tucrkdmuqj');
/** MySQL database password */
define('DB_PASSWORD', 'U4b8cG5gzu');
/** MySQL hostname */
define('DB_HOST', 'mariadb');
/** Database Charset to use in creating database tables. */
define('DB_CHARSET', 'utf8');
/** The Database Collate type. Don't change this if in doubt. */
define('DB_COLLATE', '');
/**#@+
 * Authentication Unique Keys and Salts.
 * Change these to different unique phrases!
 * You can generate these using the {@link https://api.wordpress.org/secret-key/1.1/salt/ WordPress.org secret-key service}
 */
require('wp-salt.php');
/**
 * WordPress Database Table prefix.
 *
 * You can have multiple installations in one database if you give each a unique
 * prefix. Only numbers, letters, and underscores please!
 */
/**
 * WordPress Database Table prefix.
 *
 * You can have multiple installations in one database if you give each a unique
 * prefix. Only numbers, letters, and underscores please!
 */
$table_prefix  = '61I4pu_';
/**
 * WordPress Localized Language, defaults to English.
 *
 * Change this to localize WordPress. A corresponding MO file for the chosen
 * language must be installed to wp-content/languages. For example, install
 * de_DE.mo to wp-content/languages and set WPLANG to 'de_DE' to enable German
 * language support.
 */
define('WP_DEBUG_LOG', FALSE );
define('WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY', FALSE );
define('SCRIPT_DEBUG', FALSE );
define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', TRUE);
define('CONCATENATE_SCRIPTS', FALSE);
define('WP_AUTO_UPDATE_CORE', FALSE);
define('FS_METHOD', 'direct');
define('AUTOSAVE_INTERVAL', 300 );
define('WP_POST_REVISIONS', FALSE );
define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '256');
define('WP_MAX_MEMORY_LIMIT', '1024M');
define('WPLANG', '');

/** Site URL Configuration for Docker */

define('WP_SITEURL', 'http://www.gioielleriabonanno.it.local');
define('FS_CHMOD_DIR', (0775 & ~ umask()));

 */
define( 'WP_DEBUG', FALSE );

   'token' => "e279430effe043b8c17d3f3c751c4c0846bc70c97f0eaaea766b4079001c",
   'host' => 'redis',
   'port' => 6379,
   'database' => "3135", 
   'timeout' => 2.5,
   'read_timeout' => 2.5,
   'split_alloptions' => true,
   'async_flush' => true,
   'client' => 'phpredis', 
   'compression' => 'zstd', 
   'serializer' => 'igbinary', 
   'prefetch' => true, 
   'debug' => false,
   'save_commands' => false,
   'prefix' => DB_NAME,  
   ] );
define( 'WP_REDIS_DISABLED', false );
define( 'CDN_SITE_ID', '1963135' );
define( 'CDN_SITE_TOKEN', '146c828f98fecb7c028644d4346b4c71' );

require_once(ABSPATH . 'wp-settings.php');

content.text:
Basandomi sull'analisi dei file:

**`wp-config-sample.php`** - **Può essere eliminato**
- È il file template standard di WordPress 
- Non è personalizzato per il progetto
- Serve solo come riferimento durante installazioni fresche

**`wp-config-docker.php`** - **Può essere eliminato**  
- È un file di configurazione Docker obsoleto
- Il `wp-config.php` attuale già contiene tutte le configurazioni Docker necessarie (MariaDB, Redis, Elasticsearch)
- È duplicato e non più utilizzato

Entrambi i file possono essere rimossi senza problemi poiché:
1. Il `wp-config.php` attuale è già configurato per Docker
2. Contiene le stesse impostazioni di `wp-config-docker.php` ma più complete
3. Il sample file è solo un template generico WordPress

content.text:
Perfetto! Il file `env` contiene le configurazioni corrette per l'ambiente locale che vengono utilizzate da `movefile.yml` tramite le variabili d'ambiente `<%= ENV['LOCAL_*'] %>`.

Le configurazioni sono coerenti:

**File env (locale)**:
- `LOCAL_DB_HOST = "127.0.0.1"` - Corretto per ambiente locale (non Docker)
- `LOCAL_DB_PORT = "3306"` - Porta MySQL standard
- Database, user e password corrispondenti

**wp-config.php (Docker)**:
- `DB_HOST = "mariadb"` - Service name Docker
- Rileva automaticamente l'ambiente tramite `.local` nel hostname

Tutto è configurato correttamente per funzionare sia con Wordmove (usa `env`) che con Docker (usa detection automatico in `wp-config.php`).

I've memorized the current state of the Gioielleria Bonanno project configuration:

## Key Configuration Updates (2025-08-06)

### Environment Detection System
- **wp-config.php** now has automatic environment detection using hostname `.local` suffix
- Supports both Docker local development and production seamlessly
- Environment-specific configurations for database, Redis, and Elasticsearch

### Database & Services Configuration
**Local (Docker)**:
- DB_HOST: `mariadb` (Docker service)
- EP_HOST: `http://elasticsearch:9200`
- Redis host: `redis` (Docker service)

**Production**:
- DB_HOST: `localhost`
- EP_HOST: `http://127.0.0.1:9200`  
- Redis host: `127.0.0.1`

### File Structure Status
- **wp-config-docker.php**: Obsolete, can be removed
- **wp-config-sample.php**: Standard WordPress template, can be removed
- **env**: Contains correct Wordmove local environment variables
- **movefile.yml**: Already properly configured for production deployment

### URL Configuration
- Local: `http://www.gioielleriabonanno.it.local`
- Production: `https://www.gioielleriabonanno.it`
- Staging: `https://wordpress-606288-1963135.cloudwaysapps.com`

### Production Server Details
- SSH Host: `46.101.121.18`
- User: `gbmain`  
- Path: `/home/606288.cloudwaysapps.com/tucrkdmuqj/public_html`
- Database: `tucrkdmuqj` with provided credentials

The project now has a unified configuration system that works across all environments without manual file switching.
